title: Sentinel: An Aggregation Function to Secure Decentralized Federated Learning. (arXiv:2310.08097v1 [cs.DC])
abstract: The rapid integration of Federated Learning (FL) into networking encompasses various aspects such as network management, quality of service, and cybersecurity while preserving data privacy. In this context, Decentralized Federated Learning (DFL) emerges as an innovative paradigm to train collaborative models, addressing the single point of failure limitation. However, the security and trustworthiness of FL and DFL are compromised by poisoning attacks, negatively impacting its performance. Existing defense mechanisms have been designed for centralized FL and they do not adequately exploit the particularities of DFL. Thus, this work introduces Sentinel, a defense strategy to counteract poisoning attacks in DFL. Sentinel leverages the accessibility of local data and defines a three-step aggregation protocol consisting of similarity filtering, bootstrap validation, and normalization to safeguard against malicious model updates. translated_title: Sentinel: 一种用于保护分散式联邦学习的聚合函数
translated_abstract: 将联邦学习（FL）快速整合到网络中涵盖了网络管理、服务质量和网络安全等各个方面，同时保护数据隐私。在这种情况下，分散式联邦学习（DFL）作为一种创新范式，用于训练协作模型，解决了单点失效的限制。然而，FL和DFL的安全性和可信性受到污染攻击的影响，从而对其性能产生负面影响。现有的防御机制针对集中式FL进行设计，并未充分利用DFL的特点。因此，本文引入了Sentinel，一种在DFL中对抗污染攻击的防御策略。Sentinel利用本地数据的可访问性，定义了一个三步聚合协议，包括相似性过滤、引导验证和标准化，以防止恶意模型更新。通过使用不同数据集和不同的评估指标对Sentinel进行了评估。
tldr: Sentinel是一种用于保护分散式联邦学习的防御策略，通过利用本地数据并定义一个三步聚合协议来对抗污染攻击。评估结果表明Sentinel在不同数据集和评估指标下表现良好。
en_tdlr: Sentinel is a defense strategy to protect decentralized federated learning against poisoning attacks. It leverages local data and defines a three-step aggregation protocol to counteract malicious model updates. Evaluation results demonstrate the effectiveness of Sentinel on different datasets and evaluation metrics.
